@nrk/core-css

Philosophy

@nrk/core-css is the core CSS layer for NRK. It is not a framework that provides solutions for all use cases, but instead exposes a thin foundation for styling screens and view components. @nrk/core-css uses namespacing, which makes it safe to include in your existing code base.

Grid and sizing

@nrk/core-css consist of three major components: .nrk-grid (flexbox based with inline-block fallback), .nrk-container for standardized page-width, and 12 fluid size units. Units are prefixed with .nrk-xs-, .nrk-sm-, .nrk-md-, .nrk-lg- based on minimum widths, meaning they also apply to all sizes above unless other is specified (e.g., .nrk-xs-4 applies to extra small, small, medium and large devices). Rows wrap automatically. 

/* no media query */              /* Extra small devices */
@media (min-width: 640px) { ... } /* Small devices */
@media (min-width: 720px) { ... } /* Medium devices */
@media (min-width: 990px) { ... } /* Large devices */

Tip: If you need to break out of a .nrk-container and fill the entire screen width (even when inside .nrk-grid), you can use the .nrk-xs-100 class. NB: Make sure there is a wrapper element in body with overflow:hidden to prevent .nrk-xs-100 from causing horizontal scrollbars.

SVG icon colors

All SVGs are by default filled with the inherited color property. Try our color picker at the left!

Settings

SVGs will inherit the color from the closest parent. By setting the color on the wrapping element, the SVG will inherit that color property.

Settings

The SVG inherits its fill color from the closes parent.

Settings

By setting the color-property you can choose whatever color you'd like.

Utilities

Accessibility considerations is a part of @nrk/core-css styling. Hide an element to all devices except screen readers with .nrk-sr, or make it show on focus by using .nrk-sr-focus. In general, semantic html-markup like <nav> does not require attributes for usability. Be aware though that providing aria- attributes can be useful when developing interactive widgets. Use .nrk-fade to achieve a more sublte look of elements (for instance meta data or icons in buttons).
